page.title: 14PETERSFIELD - THE HEATH
page.content: {SOUTHERN OUTSKIRTS - THE HEATH:}The Heath is common land and includes a shallow lake of about 22 acres. The lake is tree lined and with the South Downs in the background it is a popular beauty spot. {Recreation:}40 rowing boats and canoes are available for hire in summer. The lake is patrolled by water balliffs and fishing permits must be obtained. Most fishermen are members of the Hants and Sussex Alliance Club. Carp, pike, rudd, bream, tench and roach may be caught. The council controls the numbers of swans, ducks and geese found on the lake. A small carpark is at the southern end of the lake. {Golf {Course:}An 18 hole course (par 71 SSS 68) runs along the eastern edge of the lake. 7 holes are found on the Heath and 11 holes are on the south side of Sussex Road. Club membership is 450.
